H0.text: Food chain is the pattern represented by trees starting as seeds and growing into mature trees that produce more seeds.

H1.text: Life cycle is the pattern by which trees start as seeds, grow into mature trees, and produce more seeds.

H2.text: Food supply is the pattern represented by trees that start as seeds and grow into mature trees that produce more seeds.

H3.text: Life span is the pattern in which trees start as seeds and grow into mature trees that produce more seeds.

A4.text: Seeds are the primary way that trees reproduce and their seeds vary greatly in size and shape.

A5.text: Trees usually reproduce using seeds. Flowering plants have their seeds inside fruits, while conifers carry their seeds in cones, and tree ferns produce spores instead.
